Hello, is there is a way to add `primary contact`   field from create-contact API and not use associations?
Thanks for this!
<https://HubSpotdev.slack.com/archives/CBA9UA4EN/p1673953660089469>
<https://HubSpotdev.slack.com/archives/CBA9UA4EN/p1673953429788439>

Hello,

I try to get all the associations between a contact and a company so I tried to use :

<https://api.hubapi.com/crm/v3/objects/contacts?limit=100&properties=id,results&associations=companies>

But if I have more then 100 associations I dont know how to use pagination.

The request give me a url to call but it doesnt work..

My use case is : I would like to extract all the association between a contact and a company, no matter the contact. If you have a better solution, tell me !

Thank you :)
Where did you learn to use that &associations parameter?
You really want to use the actual api for getting the associations, not the query parameter
<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/crm/contacts>
This will pull 1000 the first time and will allow for simple paging
On a forum
Thanks Carter, but I would like to get the association for all the contacts without have to loop on a list, there is a possibility ?
Yes you could use the search endpoint or and also the graphql endpoint
Search endpoint: <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/crm/search>
Although the search endpoint will be a little hacky, I would highly suggest the GraphQL endpoint
Do you have CMS hub Pro or Enterprise?
Enterprise
Beautiful
Thanks a lot Carter, so fast haha
Let me send you a loom of the graphql query
one moment

<https://app.HubSpot.com/l/graphiql>
```query MyQuery {
  CRM {
    contact_collection(limit: 500) {
      items {
        email
        associations {
          company_collection__contact_to_company_unlabeled(limit: 500) {
            items {
              name
            }
          }
        }
      }
    }
  }
}```
<https://www.loom.com/share/4be6f8c8d634489fa86e0265f82cb244>
let me know if you have any questions

Thanks a lot Carter ! To be honest I don't know Graphql, so I will give you more insight about I try to do !

So, I am data engineer, and I try to export datas from HubSpot to my data warehouse. I am using Airflow (Python) to do it, so for the rest of my uses cases the API was working well. I am not sure if GraphQL is well integrated for this kind of stack (idk if it's the right word). Just let me know.

Thanks a lot Carter
of course, so you definitely can build out the integration for python it would be a little bit different than the normal api but pretty similar
